None of this is to say that Elon shouldn‚Äôt pay a sizable tax bill.¬† Of course he should.¬† 

And the answers to these questions are complex, not black and white. 

But let‚Äôs be a little more careful about this ‚Äúeat the rich‚Äù nonsense, ok?
And what would create more net benefit: Elon Musk investing $11B in startups (creating even more tax revenue and jobs and businesses), or adding yet another government program?

And what is ‚Äúgood‚Äù?

Consider the following question: 
If you had $11 billion to give away, who would you give it to: the government, or charity?

A more fundamental question: what are taxes for?

I think we should tax the least amount possible to make the basics of govt function well.

The left wants to tax you as much as possible, to pay for the ‚Äúgood stuff‚Äù

Their failed BBB bill would have created over 100 new programs.

And do we have a revenue problem or a spending problem?

Well, total federal tax collections hit 17.8% of GDP this year, which is higher than almost any year in two decades.

Both individual AND corporate tax revenue hit all-time highs in 2021.

Another consideration: If you confiscated all the wealth of the richest 550 billionaires, you‚Äôd get $2.5T, which is enough for 8 months of government spending. 

Also worth noting, you just killed your biggest tax base.¬† 

So now what?

First, do the rich pay their fair share? 

Well, the top 1% of earners pay about 40% in all federal income tax.¬† 

The top half of earners pay 90% of all federal income tax. 

Fair or No?

So Elon Musk just paid $11 BILLION in taxes. You may think Elon should pay more -or less- than that.¬†
